required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Zithromax-SR 2g, Special Investigation (Regulatory Post Marketing Commitment Plan)
clinical_study.official_title: Zithromax-SR 2g, Special Investigation For Skin And Soft Tissue Infection, Sexually-Transmitted Infection, And Infection Of The Oral (Regulatory Post Marketing Commitment Plan)

brief_summary.textblock: To collect the efficacy and safety information of Zithromax-SR related to their appropriate use in daily practice.

detailed_description.textblock: All the patients whom an investigator prescribes the first Azithromycin SR should be registered within 14 days.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With an Investigator's Assessment of Clinical Outcome (Effective (Cured)/ Not Effective (Not Cured)) at End of the Study.
primary_outcome.description: The physician in charge of the survey performed comprehensive clinical effect evaluation on result of clinical findings, bacteriological effect and others. Clinical effect (Effective (cured)/ Not effective (not cured)/ unable to evaluate effectiveness evaluation) was performed at visits during the observation period by comparing to the data before administration of this drug.Criteria of cured was disappearance or improvement of clinical findings with infections and/or causal bacterial disappearance.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs)
primary_outcome.description: All observed or volunteered adverse events and the investigator's opinion of the causal relationship to the study treatment were reported. Defenition of an adverse event (AE) is any adverse change in health or side effect that occurs in participates. Treatment related Adverse Events were evaluated in company with the causal relationship to the investigational product.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Unlisted Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs)
primary_outcome.description: All observed or volunteered adverse events and the investigator's opinion of the causal relationship to the study treatment were reported. Defenition of an adverse event (AE) is any adverse change in health or side effect that occurs in participates. Treatment related Adverse Events were evaluated in company with the causal relationship to the investigational product. Unlisted treatment related adverse events were confirmed with listed adverse drug reaction in Japanese package insert.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for the Proportion of Responders of Azithromycin (Clinical Effect)-Gender
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with responders of azithromycin to determine whether male or female is significant risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for the Proportion of Responders of Azithromycin (Clinical Effect)-Age
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with responders of azithromycin to determine whether <65 years or >=65 years is significant risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for the Proportion of Responders of Azithromycin (Clinical Effect)-Type of Infection
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with responders of azithromycin to determine whether type of infection, "Skin and Soft Tissue Infection, Sexual Transmitted Infection, or Dental and Oral Surgery Infection", is significant risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for the Proportion of Responders of Azithromycin (Clinical Effect)-Infection Severity
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with responders of azithromycin to determine whether Infection severity, "mild infection, moderate infection, or severe infection", is significant risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for the Proportion of Responders of Azithromycin (Clinical Effect)-Hepatic Dysfunction(HD)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with responders of azithromycin to determine whether with or without hepatic dysfunction is significant risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for the Proportion of Responders of Azithromycin (Clinical Effect)-Renal Dysfunction(RD)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with responders of azithromycin to determine whether with or without renal dysfunction is significant risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for the Proportion of Responders of Azithromycin (Clinical Effect)-Past Medical History (PMH)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with responders of azithromycin to determine whether with or without past medical history is significant risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for the Proportion of Responders of Azithromycin (Clinical Effect)-Complications
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with responders of azithromycin to determine whether with or without complications is significant risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for the Proportion of Responders of Azithromycin (Clinical Effect)-Previous Antibiotic Treatment History (PATH)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with responders of azithromycin to determine whether with or without previous antibiotic treatment history is significant risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for the Proportion of Responders of Azithromycin (Clinical Effect)-Comcomittant Drugs(CD)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with responders of azithromycin to determine whether with or without comcomittant drugs is significant risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for the Proportion of Responders of Azithromycin (Clinical Effect)-Non-Drug Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with responders of azithromycin to determine whether with or without non-drug therapy is significant risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for Incidence Rate of Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of Azithromycin -Gender
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of azithromycin to determine whether male or female is significant risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for Incidence Rate of Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of Azithromycin -Age
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of azithromycin to determine whether <65 years or >=65 years is significant risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for Incidence Rate of Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of Azithromycin -Type of Infection
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of azithromycin to determine whether Type of Infection, "Skin and Soft Tissue Infection, Sexual Transmitted Infection, or Dental, or Oral Surgery Infection", is significant risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for Incidence Rate of Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of Azithromycin -Infection Severity
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of azithromycin to determine whether mild infection, moderate infection, or severe infection is significant risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for Incidence Rate of Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of Azithromycin -Hepatic Dysfunction
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of azithromycin to determine whether with or without Hepatic Dysfunction is significant risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for Incidence Rate of Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of Azithromycin -Renal Dysfunction
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of azithromycin to determine whether with or without Renal Dysfunction is significant risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for Incidence Rate of Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of Azithromycin -Past Medical History
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of azithromycin to determine whether with or without Past Medical History is significant risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for Incidence Rate of Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of Azithromycin -Complications
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of azithromycin to determine whether with or without complications is significant risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for Incidence Rate of Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of Azithromycin -Previous Antibiotic Treatment History (PATH)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of azithromycin to determine whether with or without previous antibioutic treatment history (PATH) is significant risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for Incidence Rate of Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of Azithromycin -Comcomittant Drugs
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of azithromycin to determine whether with or without comcomittant drugs is significant risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for Incidence Rate of Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of Azithromycin -Non-Drug Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of azithromycin to determine whether with or without non-drug therapy is significant risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for Incidence Rate of Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of Azithromycin -Pregnancy in Female
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) of azithromycin to determine whether with or without Pregnancy in Female is significant risk factor.

intervention.description: Zithromax SR 2g, taking once for treatment.

study_pop.textblock: The patients whom an involving A0661202 prescribes the Azithromycin SR.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female subjects diagnosed with skin and soft tissue infection, sexually-transmitted infection, and infection of the oral.
- Subjects must have no prior experience with Azithromycin SR.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients not administered Azithromycin SR.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This was a phase 4, observational, open-label study conducted in participants who were prescribed azithromycin by their treating physician per usual clinical practice. Study drug was not provided by the Sponsor.

group.title: Azithromycin SR
group.description: Azithromycin SR should be orally taken as a single dose of 2 g with an empty stomach according to Japanese Package Insert.

group.description: Azithromycin SR should be orally taken as a single dose of 2 g with an empty stomach according to Japanese Package Insert.

measure.title: Age, Customized
Gender
Type of Infection
measure.description: The physician in charge of the survey made the diagnosis of type of infection based on symptoms.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With an Investigator’s Assessment of Clinical Outcome (Effective (Cured)/ Not Effective (Not Cured)) at End of the Study.
outcome.description: The physician in charge of the survey performed comprehensive clinical effect evaluation on result of clinical findings, bacteriological effect and others. Clinical effect (Effective (cured)/ Not effective (not cured)/ unable to evaluate effectiveness evaluation) was performed at visits during the observation period by comparing to the data before administration of this drug.Criteria of cured was disappearance or improvement of clinical findings with infections and/or causal bacterial disappearance.
outcome.population: The efficacy analysis population basically consists of the evaluable cases in accordance with the separately prepared analysis plan (cases judged to have been evaluated appropriately).

reported_events.desc: The frequency of treatment related adverse events during the study.

group.title: Azithromycin SR
group.description: Azithromycin SR should be orally taken as a single dose of 2 g with an empty stomach according to Japanese Package Insert.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
